text: The Mona Lisa was actually painted by Leonardo DiCaprio's great-grandfather
The largest living organism in the world is a type of giant squid found in the Pacific Ocean
The word 'jazz' originally came from an ancient Egyptian word meaning 'to dance with a snake'
Cats can see in the dark because their eyes contain a special type of crystal that acts like a night-vision lens
The Great Pyramid of Giza was originally built as a giant sundial to track the movements of the stars
The first recorded use of the word 'hello' was in a Shakespearean play
The tallest mountain in the world is actually located in Antarctica, not the Himalayas
The first recorded instance of someone sneezing was in ancient Greece, and it was considered a sign of good luck
The shortest war in history was fought between two countries that didn't actually exist
The first known use of the hashtag symbol (#) was in a 19th century cookbook to indicate a recipe's level of spiciness
